item.title: There Are People In The UK Who Would "Love" To Plant A Bomb On A Plane, Says Foreign Secretary
item.description:
There Are People In The UK Who Would "Love" To Plant A Bomb On A Plane, Says Foreign Secretary

There are people in the UK who would "love" to plant a bomb on an aeroplane, the foreign secretary has said. Speaking on the Andrew Marr Show, Philip Hammond said the level of security in UK airports has stopped people from smuggling explosives onto airplanes for decades and that it should be the example to follow throughout the world, even if it meant additional costs and delays at airports in areas where ISIS is active.

item.title: Myanmar's First Free Election In Decades All Depends On The Military's Mood
item.description:
Myanmar's First Free Election In Decades All Depends On The Military's Mood

YANGON, Myanmar - Daw Kyi Pyar was just 9-years-old, but she had followed her father to downtown Yangon, where tens of thousands of students, ochre-robed monks, doctors, street vendors and others were gathered for a rally.

item.title: This Is Why Junior Doctors Are Considering Going On Strike
item.description:
This Is Why Junior Doctors Are Considering Going On Strike

BMA members will have until 18 November to decide whether they would want to go ahead with industrial action in the lead-up to Christmas. Health secretary Jeremy Hunt has said the changes will "create a fairer deal for doctors and patients".

item.title: A British Plane Had To Evade A Missile In Egypt
item.description:
A British Plane Had To Evade A Missile In Egypt

Julian Stratenschulte / AFP / Getty Images Reports say the rocket came within 1,000ft of the Thomson plane, but the pilot was able to land safely without telling 189 holidaymakers on board, according to the Daily Mail . "The pilot was in the cockpit and saw the rocket coming towards the plane.

item.title: Iran's President Tells His Media To Chill Out
item.description:
Iran's President Tells His Media To Chill Out

In a swipe at the hardliners who have railed against a gradual rapprochement with the West, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani on Sunday called for media in his country to be more moderate and rational in their coverage of the "post-sanctions era."

item.title: 9 Super-Cool Photos Capture HBCU Homecoming Style
item.description:
9 Super-Cool Photos Capture HBCU Homecoming Style

Wayne Lawrence is a Brooklyn-based photographer who is well-known for his portraits. He went to Atlanta for BuzzFeed News to work on a project about legacy families and also took some killer street style photos while he was at homecoming. We spoke with Wayne about his work and his approach to portraits during this assignment.

item.title: It Will Be Impossible For Cameron To Block Another Independence Referendum, Says Salmond
item.description:
It Will Be Impossible For Cameron To Block Another Independence Referendum, Says Salmond

It will be impossible for David Cameron to block a second referendum on Scottish independence, Alex Salmond has warned. On Monday the SNP will vote to give the Scottish parliament the power to hold another referendum, but Salmond told BuzzFeed News that, even if the proposal is voted down, Cameron will be powerless to stop a second independence vote.

item.title: Detainees Are "Trashing Shit" On Christmas Island And No One Is In Charge
item.description:
Detainees Are "Trashing Shit" On Christmas Island And No One Is In Charge

Scott Fisher / Getty Images The Department of Immigration and Border Protection has issued a statement denying that a riot is taking place inside the centre, instead referring to the events as a "major disturbance". "There is currently no large scale 'riot' involving the majority of the centre's population...

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn Attacks Head Of Armed Forces For Interfering In Politics
item.description:
Jeremy Corbyn Attacks Head Of Armed Forces For Interfering In Politics

Jeremy Corbyn has slammed the chief of defence for "taking sides" in the debate over the UK's Trident nuclear weapons programme. On Sunday morning, Gen Sir Nicholas Houghton criticised Corbyn's anti-nuclear stance, saying he would "worry" if the Labour leader became prime minister as he would risk undermining the nuclear deterrent.

item.title: The Queen Leads Remembrance Sunday Tributes In London
item.description:
The Queen Leads Remembrance Sunday Tributes In London

The ceremony at the Cenotaph in Whitehall commemorated those who have lost their lives in battle for Britain.
